body.p: The IFRIC noted that the contributor may not be able to access the assets of the fund (including cash or cash equivalents) for many years (eg until it undertakes the decommissioning), if ever. Therefore, the IFRIC concluded that the nature of the contributor’s interest and the restriction on access should be disclosed. The IFRIC also concluded that this disclosure is equally relevant when a contributor’s interest in a fund is accounted for by consolidation, proportional consolidation or using the equity method because the contributor’s ability to access the underlying assets may be similarly restricted.
